availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, minister. Kentucky native. Son of John Marshall and Rebecca Marshall. Married to Julia Ann Henry Marshall in Green County, Kentucky, on January 25, 1838. Father of Elizabeth R. Marshall and Alonzo H. Marshall. Married to Joanna E. Johnston Marshall in Taylor County, Kentucky, in November 1857. Father of Sarah E. Marshall. Minister in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Minister in Green County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Green County in 1860. Held an additional two enslaved persons in trust in Green County in 1860.
